content: Perhaps not humanity as a whole. Mostly it is the developed nations with sophisticated weapons systems that have worked to limit this form of weapon. Chemical weapons may be no worse than phosphorous bombs — which Israel has been known to use. But chemical weapons are cheap and take away some of the considerable advantage of states that have invested so much in explosive and incendiary capability. It’s like a wild card that eats away at conventional weaponry advantage. Being incinerated and gagging on sarin are both unpleasant ways to die.
